# Assignment 3 - Bayesian Theorem


::: {.cell hash='01_probability_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_17ae07beda240e54fa31817ea0c737b9'}

:::

::: {.cell hash='01_probability_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-6_83dc50bf06cc7260fb52b4ce8baef78b'}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Print the results
cat("a. P(~Faulty_prod | Alarm):", P_not_Faulty_prod_given_Alarm, "\n")
```

a. P(~Faulty_prod | Alarm): 0.1983471 

```{.r .cell-code}
cat("b. P(Faulty_prod | Alarm):", P_Faulty_prod_given_Alarm, "\n")
```

b. P(Faulty_prod | Alarm): 0.8016529 
:::

::: {.cell hash='01_probability_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-7_f4bf019dc783f3ee5543c30f99aa2c51'}

:::

::: {.cell hash='01_probability_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-8_a643324ca550e841f9182b3b412b4946'}

```{.r .cell-code}
cat("These results show that in case the alarm is triggered, there is a possibility of about", 
    percentage_not_Faulty_prod_given_Alarm, "% that the product is flawless and a probability of", 
    percentage_Faulty_prod_given_Alarm, "% that the product is faulty.", "\n")
```

These results show that in case the alarm is triggered, there is a possibility of about 19.83 % that the product is flawless and a probability of 80.17 % that the product is faulty. 
:::
